title: Coronation Street and Emmerdale cancelled tonight ahead of devastating week
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest soaps stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Coronation Street and Emmerdale have both been cancelled tonight - and on Monday.

The Rugby World Cup has hooked the daytime TV off the air and now football is taking shots at the soaps.

England are taking on the Czech Republic in an important Euro 2020 qualifier, which will be broadcast on ITV at 7pm.

This means Corrie and Emmerdale have both been kicked into touch, but soap fans can still get their EastEnders helping on BBC One at 8p,.

Corrie viewers will be forced to wait an entire week before they see more action from the cobbles ahead of a devastating week.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Announcing the news on Twitter , Asha actress Tanisha Gorey said: "So you've probably noticed we're not on tonight or Monday. Don't worry we will be back on Wednesday with a brand new episode for you."

From the week beginning Monday October 21 there will be a whopping seven episodes from Weatherfield.

There will be an extra episode on the Thursday at 8.30pm, while Emmerdale will also have an hour-long special on the Tuesday.

(Image: SCU)

(Image: ITV)

It will be an emotional week for Corrie viewers as Sinead Tinker's final scenes will air.

Terminally-ill Sinead received the devastating news that she has just weeks left to live on this week's Corrie.

It's set to be a tear-jerker when Sinead passes away surrounded by her loved ones.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Corrie viewers are not happy that the soap has been taken off air for a whole week.

One angry fan said: "Why not just put the football on ITV 2? Surely football fans are capable of changing the channel?"

"Wish they’d put flaming football on itv2," added another.

A third said: "Not very happy Corrie not on. Can’t understand why football not on ITV 2. Looking forward to see Corrie on Wednesday"

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The ITV schedule has faced major changes over the last few weeks thanks to a lot of sport.

This Morning and Loose Women have been cancelled six times during the Rugby World Cup, leaving angry viewers without their daily programmes.

And it seems nothing is sacred anymore as even Lorraine faced the chop on Wednesday alongside the other daytime shows.

*Coronation Street airs Monday, Wednesdays and Fridays on ITV at 7.30pm and 8.30pm

*Emmerdale airs weekday on ITV at 7pm with an extra episode on Thursdays at 8pm
description: Both Corrie and Emmerdale have been dropped tonight and on Monday in a major schedule shake-up
